title: Lesson 93
paragraph: Representation and occurrence involve noticing events and understanding their significance. Emergent situations require careful assessment and optional strategies.

words.meaning: to act or speak on behalf of
words.example: He represents the company at conferences.
Accidents can occur if precautions are ignored.

words.meaning: to cause physical or emotional harm
words.example: He injured his leg during the match.
Slippery floors are a hazard at work.

words.meaning: a long, thin strand; a continuous theme
words.example: The thread of the story was easy to follow.
There was implicit trust between the partners.
The team was unified by a common goal.

words.meaning: available as a choice but not required
words.example: Participation in the workshop is optional.
We need an estimate of the costs before proceeding.
